definition: (particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
tooth/ivory/CL:顆|颗[ke1]
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
interjection of surprise/Oh my!
Heavens!/My goodness!
Yanoda, a rainforest in southern Hainan

sentences.english: My younger sister. Look at your dirty face.
sentences.chinese: 我的小姑子呀，你看这小脸花的。

sentences.english: How time fast! The sun set. It is time to come back.
sentences.chinese: 时间过得真快呀，太阳下山了，我们也该回去了。

sentences.english: Mongolian national minority's traditional virtue are many, the father teaches me for the generation toward downloading.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族的传统美德多呀，阿爸教我代代往下传呀。

sentences.english: Mongolian national minority's traditional virtue are many, the father teaches me for the generation toward downloading.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族的传统美德多呀，阿爸教我代代往下传呀。

sentences.english: Moon for what do you wait?
sentences.chinese: 月儿呀，你在等候什么呢？

sentences.english: The next morning, he asks the monks what the sound was, but they say, "We can't tell you."
sentences.chinese: 第二天一大早，男子就问和尚，那声音是啥呀。

sentences.english: How am I going to write my lab report?
I hold the Cupid's arrow chasing you, you're wearing a bulletproof vest to fly.
sentences.chinese: 我举着丘比特的箭追呀追，你穿着防弹背心飞呀飞。

sentences.english: I hold the Cupid's arrow chasing you, you're wearing a bulletproof vest to fly.
sentences.chinese: 我举着丘比特的箭追呀追，你穿着防弹背心飞呀飞。

sentences.english: Please ask you do I want to how learn and then can say that thing that I do out?
sentences.chinese: 请问你我要怎么学才能把我说的那个东西做出来呀？

sentences.english: How can I spend my time in such a hot day without air-conditioning?
sentences.chinese: 这样炎热的天，没有冷气，怎么过呀？

sentences.english: Who’s the cutest kitty in the world?
sentences.chinese: 谁是这个世界上最可爱的猫咪呀？

sentences.english: Wolowitz: You make me want to kill myself.
To be or not to be, I used to think that it was bullshit.
sentences.chinese: 活呀还是死呀，过去我觉得这话就是胡扯。

sentences.english: How many is that the moisture-preserving powder cake of Diao congealed fat special counter replaces the core price?
sentences.chinese: 迪奥凝脂保湿粉饼专柜替芯的价格是多少呀？

sentences.english: Aiya, then what is afternoon meal?
sentences.chinese: 哎呀，那午餐有什么吃呀？

definition: interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
hey (to call sb)
hey (to express disagreement)
sigh (to express regret)
hey (to express agreement)
hey (to express surprise)
(onom.) laughing out loud
woolen material

particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?")/particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?")/particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?")/(at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action/particle indicating strong affirmation
but/however/(used for emphasis) indeed
(onom.) smack!
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
you (plural)
(question particle for "yes-no" questions)
see 嗎啡|吗啡, morphine
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
oh (interjection indicating doubt or surprise)
to chant
